about_the_game:
You’ve done this a hundred times before—show up, lay tiles, get paid. The job is simple, the process familiar. The homeowner barely speaks, keeping to himself as you work. Nothing seems out of the ordinary. The day moves along like any other. But as the hours pass, something begins to feel… off. It’s not the job itself—that part is routine. It’s something else. A nagging sense that you’re missing something important, that there’s more to this house than what’s in front of you.

A slow descent into mystery and tension, this psychological horror experience pulls you in with its realism—until the cracks start to show. Will you finish the job, or will you uncover something you were never meant to find?

Game Mechanics

Lay tiles, just like any other job. Spread mortar, pick up a tile, and place it. Simple, repetitive, almost relaxing—until it isn’t.

Pick up tiles, spread mortar, place tiles – A straightforward job… at first.

Stay focused – Keep working and ignore distractions.

Immerse yourself in the task – Just a normal day’s work. Nothing more.

Features

A Creepy, Unfolding Story – What begins as an ordinary job takes a disturbing turn.
A Mysterious House – The more you observe, the more unsettling the details become.
Realistic Graphics – Every detail, from the environment to the smallest objects, draws you deeper into the experience.

You’re here to lay tiles. That’s the job. That’s all there is to it.

…Right?

content_descriptors.notes: Content Warning – This game contains graphic content, including gore and unsettling imagery. It may not be suitable for all audiences. Please proceed with caution if you are sensitive to such material.

name: The Last Job 2

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 8/10/11 (64-Bit)
  • Processor: Intel I5-2500K, AMD FX-8120
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1650 Super
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 15 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS *: Windows 8/10/11 (64-Bit)
  • Processor: Intel I7-3770, AMD FX 8350 4.0 Ghz
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce RTX 2070 Super
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 15 GB available space

short_description: It’s just another job — show up, lay tiles, get paid. The homeowner keeps to himself, the work is straightforward, and the day moves along like any other. But as time passes, you realize this job might not be as simple as it seems.
